title: The Rains of Castamere
transcript:
CATELYN STARK: Are you sure about this?
ROBB STARK: No.
CATELYN STARK: It's dangerous.
ROBB STARK: If we take Tywin's castle from him, the lords of Westeros will realize he's not invincible. Take his home, take his gold, take his power."
CATELYN STARK: Why are you telling me?
ROBB STARK: You begged me not to send Theon to negotiate with his father and I ignored your advice.
ROBB STARK: Now Winterfell is burned to the ground. The North is overrun with Ironborn and Bran and Rickon are gone.
ROBB STARK: So, Casterly Rock? I'm asking your advice."
CATELYN STARK: We have enough men?
ROBB STARK: If Walder Frey cooperates.
CATELYN STARK: If reinforcements arrive from King's Landing, before we take the castle, we'll be caught between Tywin's army and the sea."
ROBB STARK: We'll lose the war and die the way father died. Or worse.
CATELYN STARK: Show them how it feels to lose what they love.
WALDER: My honored guests, be welcome within my walls and at my table. I extend to you my hospitality and protection in the light of the Seven."
ROBB STARK: We thank you for your hospitality, my lord."
ROBB STARK: I have come to make my apologies, my lord, and to beg your forgiveness."
WALDER: Don't beg my forgiveness, your Grace. It wasn't me you spurned, it was my girls."
WALDER: One of them was supposed to be queen, now none of them are."
WALDER: This is Arwyn, my daughter. My daughter Walda, my daughter Derwa, my daughter Waldra."
WALDER: My eldest granddaughters Ginia and Neila.
WALDER: Serra and Sarra, granddaughters, twins. You could have had either. Could have had both for all I care."
WALDER: My granddaughter Marianne. My granddaughter Freya. My granddaughter...W-W-Wertha? Waldra? Waldina?
MERRY: I'm Merry.
WALDER: Fine. And here's my youngest daughter Shirei, though she hasn't bled yet. Clearly you don't have the patience for all that."
ROBB STARK: My ladies. All men should keep their word, kings most of all. I was pledged to marry one of you and I broke that vow. The fault is not with you. Any man would be lucky to have any one of you. I did what I did not to slight you, but because I loved another. I know these words cannot set right the wrong I have done to you and your house. I beg your forgiveness and pledge to do all I can to make amends so the Freys of the Crossing and the Starks of Winterfell may once again be friends."
WALDER: Very good.
WALDER: There she is. Come closer, let me have a look at you."
WALDER: Still can't see you. Old eyes.
WALDER: Love. That's what the Starks of Winterfell call it, eh? Heh. Very honorable, I call it a pretty face. Mmmm, very pretty. Prettier than this lot, that's for sure. Very shapely as well. Oh, you try to hide her under that dress. If you wanted to hide her, you shouldn't have brought her here in the first place."
WALDER: I can always see what's going on beneath a dress. Been at this a long time. I bet when you take that dress off, everything stays right where it is. Doesn't drop an inch."
WALDER: Your king says he betrayed me for love. I say he betrayed me for firm tits and a tight fit.
WALDER: And I can respect that. When I was your age, I'd have broken fifty oaths to get into that without a second thought. Well, I've enough room in the hall for you lot. We'll set up tents outside with food and ale for the rest of your men."
ROBB STARK: Thank you, my lord."
WALDER: Well, let's get ready. The wine will flow red and the music will play loud and we'll put this mess behind us."
DAENERYS TARGARYEN: Where?
DAARIO: There.
DAARIO: There, it's a back gate. My men use it when they visit Yunkai's bed slaves."
JORAH MORMONT: Your men but not you?
DAARIO: I have no interest in slaves. A man cannot make love to property.
DAARIO: This is where we enter the city. Very few guards, they know me. They let me inside."
BARRISTAN: We're not gonna sneak an army through a back gate.
DAARIO: I kill the guards. I take your two best men and lead them through the back streets, which I know well, and open the front gates."
DAARIO: Then comes the army. Once the walls are breached, the city will fall in hours."
JORAH MORMONT: Or perhaps you'll lead Grey Worm and me to the slaughter, cutting the head off our army. The masters of Yunkai will pay you your fee and you won't have to split it three ways cause you've already slaughtered your partners."
DAARIO: You have a very suspicious mind. In my experience, only dishonest people think this way."
JORAH MORMONT: You command the Unsullied. What do you think?
DAENERYS TARGARYEN: Lo jention mirre nūmāzme ēza, iderenna qopsa verdagon issa."
GREY WORM: I trust him.
DAENERYS TARGARYEN: You leave tonight.
JORAH MORMONT: Very good. We'll prepare.
BARRISTAN: Ser Jorah. You can use an extra sword.
JORAH MORMONT: You're the Queensguard, Ser Barristan. Your place is by the Queen. If we are truly her loyal servants, we'll do whatever needs to be done. No matter the cost, no matter our pride."
SAM TARLY: We're west of Castle Black, but the Nightfort's closest to us. It was the first castle on the Wall. The Watch abandoned it during the reign of King Jaehaerys I. Too big, impossible to maintain. Other than Castle Black itself, the Nightfort's the perfect castle for us. It's got a secret sally port, the Black Gate, as old as the Wall itself. No one's used it for centuries, most likely. It leads through the Wall right down into the Nightfort, if no one knows how to find it, which, it just so happens I do."
GILLY: How do you know all that?
SAM TARLY: I read about it in a very old book.
GILLY: You know all that from staring at marks on paper?
SAM TARLY: Yes.
GILLY: You're like a wizard.
GILLY: Our father used to tell us that no wildling ever looked upon the Wall and lived. Here we are. Alive.
SANDOR CLEGANE: Remember what happens to children who run. I'm your father and I'll do the talking.
PIG FARMER: The roads have gone right to hell, haven't they? Cracked three spokes this morning."
SANDOR CLEGANE: Need a hand?
PIG FARMER: Need about eight hands.
PIG FARMER: Got to get this salt pork to The Twins in time for the wedding.
PIG FARMER: Many thanks.
ARYA STARK: Don't! Don't kill him.
SANDOR CLEGANE: Dead rats don't squeak.
ARYA STARK: You're so dangerous, aren't you? Saying scary things to little girls. Killing little boys and old people. A real hard man you are."
SANDOR CLEGANE: More than anyone you know.
ARYA STARK: You're wrong. I know a killer. A real killer.
SANDOR CLEGANE: That so?
ARYA STARK: You'd be like a kitten to him. He'd kill you with his little finger.
SANDOR CLEGANE: That him?
ARYA STARK: No.
SANDOR CLEGANE: Good.
ARYA STARK: Don't kill him! Please. Please don't.
SANDOR CLEGANE: You're very kind. Someday it'll get you killed.
OSHA: Where are we?
BRAN STARK: The Gift, I think. Brandon The Builder gave all this land south of the Wall to the Night's Watch for their sustenance and support. Maester Luwin taught me that."
JOJEN: Doesn't seem to be supporting anyone at the moment.
MEERA: It's good land and there's no war up here. Why leave?
BRAN STARK: Wildlings.
BRAN STARK: Sorry. But they come over the Wall and raid, steal, carry off women."
RICKON: Old Nan said they turn your skull into a cup and make you drink your own blood from it.
RICKON: That's what Old Nan said.
JOJEN: There's a storm coming.
BRAN STARK: I don't see any.
MEERA: It's as good a place to shelter as any.
OSHA: We can drink some blood while we wait. I don't need much.
ORELL: Only one old man and eight good horses.
TORMUND: What's one old man doing with eight horses?
JON SNOW: He breeds them for the Watch.
YGRITTE: How's he keep folks from stealing them?
JON SNOW: The Watch protects him.
ORELL: Not today they don't. He's selling horses, he's got some gold in there."
TORMUND: And proper steel.
ORELL: Let's carve him up.
JON SNOW: We just take the horses and go. The old man's no threat.
ORELL: I keep telling you.
YGRITTE: He's an old man. A spear through the heart's a better way to die than coughing up your last with no one but your horses to hear.
JON SNOW: The Watch might send a few men looking for a horse thief. They'll send a lot more to hunt down murderers.
TORMUND: I hope so. Killing crows in their castle is tough. Killing them out here in the open, that's what we do."
TORMUND: Spread out. Surround the hut and move in.
JON SNOW: Ygritte!
TORMUND: Clear the barn!
ARYA STARK: No one's going to believe you're a hog farmer if you eat them all.
SANDOR CLEGANE: Best part of the animal.
SANDOR CLEGANE: Don't worry, they're still there."
ARYA STARK: I know they're still there.
SANDOR CLEGANE: You check every five minutes like you're afraid they're gonna move.
ARYA STARK: I'm not afraid.
SANDOR CLEGANE: Of course you are. You're almost there and you're afraid you won't make it. The closer you get, the worse the fear gets. No point in trying to hide behind that face. I know fear when I see it. Seen it a lot."
ARYA STARK: I knew fear when I saw it in you. You're afraid of fire.
ARYA STARK: When Beric's sword went up in flames, you looked like a scared little girl."
ARYA STARK: And I know why, too. I heard what your brother did to you. Pressed your face to the fire like you're a nice juicy mutton chop."
SANDOR CLEGANE: That give you some ideas?
ARYA STARK: Might do.
SANDOR CLEGANE: Go ahead then. You might get away. Might even make it there on your own. They're just over the river. The closest you've been to family since Ilyn Payne snipped your daddy's neck.
ARYA STARK: Someday I'm gonna put a sword through your eye and out the back of your skull.
BRAN STARK: How are we going to get past the Wall? My uncle said it's 700 feet high.
BRAN STARK: How did you get past it?
OSHA: Got in a boat and rowed past the Bay of Seals.
BRAN STARK: It would take us two months to get to the Bay of Seals.
OSHA: Some climb straight up the ice.
BRAN STARK: Even Hodor's not strong enough to climb the Wall with me on his back.
HODOR: Hodor!
JOJEN: Nineteen castles guard the Wall. Only three are still manned.
JOJEN: One of those abandoned fortresses will give us a way through.
BRAN STARK: My uncle said the gates were sealed with ice and stone when the castles were deserted.
MEERA: Well, we'll have to open them up again."
OLD MAN: Whoa, whoa, whoa!"
MEERA: There's a rider out there.
JOJEN: Just one?
MEERA: There's more.
OSHA: It's just thunder, sweet giant."
HODOR: Hodor.
OLD MAN: I yield. I yield.
JOJEN: Wildlings.
OSHA: Where's Shaggydog and Summer?
BRAN STARK: Hunting.
JOJEN: Shhh, quiet, Hodor."
JOJEN: Make him shut up. If they hear us…
BRAN STARK: To Hodor] Hush, Hodor. No, no more Hodoring."
BRAN STARK: Hodor, calm down."
OSHA: You need to keep quiet.
JOJEN: They're gonna hear us.
BRAN STARK: Hodor, be quiet."
BRAN STARK: Hodor, calm down. Hodor, be quiet!"
MEERA: What did you do?
BRAN STARK: Nothing. I don't know.
RICKON: What's That?
OSHA: That's a horse dying.
WILDLING: Bring them over here.
WILDLING: That was the last of them. The rest are dead.
ORELL: I heard shouting up there.
TORMUND: Thunder.
ORELL: I know the difference between shouting and thunder.
TORMUND: Maybe it's ghosts.
TORMUND: That won't help you, grandpa."
TORMUND: Where you riding?
OLD MAN: Doesn't matter now, does it?"
TORMUND: No, it doesn't matter now."
ORELL: Cut his throat or he'll tell the crows we're here.
TORMUND: You understand.
OLD MAN: Let me stand at least.
OLD MAN: Let me go with a bit of dignity.
ORELL: Make the crow kill him. You're one of us now. Prove it.
JOJEN: The wolves are out there.
BRAN STARK: I can't do it by choice. I don't know how. It happens in my dreams.
JOJEN: You're a warg, Bran. It's in your blood."
BRAN STARK: I can't.
JOJEN: You just did, with him."
JOJEN: A wolf is nothing compared to that.
OLD MAN: She looks sharp.
YGRITTE: Do it. Do it.
ORELL: Told ya. He's still one of them.
TORMUND: Go on, boy."
TORMUND: Go on!
ORELL: He's a crow. He'll always be a crow. And here's his crow wife guarding him. He'll stab us in the back first chance he gets.
TORMUND: Kill him!
TORMUND: He's one of them!
YGRITTE: No!
TORMUND: Do you hear me?
TORMUND: You're not gonna die for one of them.
JOJEN: Do it. They'll find us if you don't.
JON SNOW: You were right the whole time.
DAARIO: When you hear a songbirdo s whistle, you come. I'm a great whistler, the greatest in the land."
DAARIO: Daario Naharis.
DAARIO: That one was quick.
JORAH MORMONT: There may be others.
DAARIO: I doubt it. The Yunkish prefer to let their slaves do their fighting for them.
JORAH MORMONT: That's what you call a few guards?
ROSLIN: Lord Edmure, I hope I'm not a disappointment to you."
EDMURE: You're a delight to me, my lady."
SEPTON: You may now cloak the bride and bring her under your protection.
SEPTON: In the sight of the Seven, I hereby seal these two souls, binding them as one for eternity. Look upon each other and say the words."
EDMURE ROSLIN: Father, Smith, Warrior, Mother, Maiden, Crone, Stranger. I am hers and she is mine from this day until the end of my days."
MEERA: Is that safe?
OSHA: They're long gone.
BRAN STARK: You were right. I can get inside Summer's mind whenever I want.
JOJEN: Of course you can. North of the Wall there are wildlings who can control all sorts of animals. But you did a lot more than that. You got inside Hodor's mind.
BRAN STARK: They can't do that north of the Wall?
JOJEN: No one can do that. Anywhere.
BRAN STARK: When I was looking through Summer's eyes, I saw Jon."
RICKON: Where?
BRAN STARK: He was with the wildlings. They tried to kill him but he got away.
OSHA: He'll be heading back to Castle Black then. That's where we should go.
BRAN STARK: For all we know, Castle Black's already under attack. If this many wildlings got through-"
OSHA: I already told you. I'm not going north of the Wall.
BRAN STARK: Everything Jojen told me is true. You saw what I did to Hodor. I have to find the three-eyed raven.
OSHA: Listen to me, little lord."
BRAN STARK: Don't worry, I'm not asking you to come with me. It won't be safe for Rickon."
RICKON: Me? I'm coming with you.
BRAN STARK: No. You and Osha and Shaggydog head for the Last Hearth. The Umbers are our bannermen. They'll protect you.
RICKON: I'm coming with you. I'm your brother. I have to protect you.
BRAN STARK: Right now, I have to protect you."
BRAN STARK: Robb's at war and I'm going beyond the Wall. If something happens to us, you're the heir to Winterfell."
BRAN STARK: Will you know how to find the last Hearth?
OSHA: You Southerners build your big castles and you never move. You're easy to find.
RICKON: We're not Southerners.
RICKON: And I don't want to leave you.
OSHA: Shhh. Come here, little soldier. You and me, we're gonna have some adventures."
BRAN STARK: You don't have to do any of this.
OSHA: Your family took me in and was good to me when they had no cause to be. Shhh. We'll be fine, you and me. The Umbers are great warriors. Even I heard about them growing up. They'll teach you how to swing a sword."
RICKON: I know how to swing a sword.
BRAN STARK: You're leaving now? It's the middle of the night.
OSHA: I learned to walk in darkness.
OSHA: Say your good-byes, little man."
OSHA: Keep this one safe. He means the world to me.
DAENERYS TARGARYEN: We've been waiting a long time. Haven't we? Well I don't know, you tell me. How long does it take to sack a city?"
JORAH MORMONT: It was just as you said. They did not believe until it was too late. Their slave soldiers threw down their spears and surrendered.
DAENERYS TARGARYEN: And Daario Naharis?
DAARIO: The city is yours, my queen."
TALISA: They're good, aren't they?"
LOTHAR: They ought to be because they cost enough.
BLACKFISH: Look at the crowd there.
CATELYN STARK: He complained about this marriage the entire ride from Riverrun and now look at him.
BLACKFISH: The Godo s love to reward a fool.
CATELYN STARK: Uncle.
BLACKFISH: What? He's my nephew, I love him. And he's a damned fool."
CATELYN STARK: Don't you drink, Lord Bolton?"
ROOSE: Never do, my lady. Dulls the senses."
BLACKFISH: That's the point. Didn't you marry one of these Frey girls?
ROOSE: Aye. Lord Walder let me choose any of his granddaughters and promised me the girl's weight in silver as a dowry. So I have a fat, young bride."
CATELYN STARK: I hope she makes you very happy.
ROOSE: Well, she's made me very rich."
BLACKFISH: Pardon, my lord, my lady. I need to find a tree to piss on."
ROBB STARK: My mother's alone with Roose Bolton. I should rescue her.
TALISA: Your mother is less in need of rescue than any woman I've ever met.
ROBB STARK: Be kind. She's finally starting to like you.
TALISA: And I like her. But if she had her way, I would be back in Volantis, playing my harp and you would be sitting over there , eating blackberries out of Roslin Frey's hand."
ROBB STARK: Perhaps I've made a terrible mistake.
ROBB STARK: Striking your king is an act of treason.
TALISA: No, don't. Don't insult them."
WALDER: Your Grace.
WALDER: The Septon has prayed his prayers, some words were said and Lord Edmure has wrapped my daughter in a cloak. But they are not yet man and wife. A sword needs a sheath . And a wedding needs a bedding . What does my sire say?"
EVERYBODY: To bed! To bed! To bed!
ROBB STARK: If you think the time is right, Lord Walder, by all means, let us bed them."
EDMURE: Ho-ho! Careful now, ladies. Once you set that monster free, there's no caging him again ."
CATELYN STARK: Poor girl.
ROOSE: Every bride suffers the same. I'm sure you endured yours with grace.
CATELYN STARK: Oh, Ned forbade it. He said it wouldn't be right if he broke a man's jaw on our wedding night."
TALISA: That is a very strange custom.
ROBB STARK: I suppose it does seem strange from a foreigner's perspective.
TALISA: It seems normal to you?
ROBB STARK: It's tradition. Without the bedding ceremony, there's no real proof the lord and lady consummated their marriage."
TALISA: No, but there are other ways of providing proof."
ROBB STARK: Boy or girl?
TALISA: I don't know. But if it's a boy, I know what we should name him."
ROBB STARK: Oh, do you? It seems to me the father should have some say in his son's naming."
TALISA: Eddard. Don't you want to teach little Ned Stark how to ride horses?
ROBB STARK: I do.
SANDOR CLEGANE: Whoa, whoa, whoa, whoa."
FREY GUARD: Where are you going?
SANDOR CLEGANE: Got salt pork for the feast.
FREY GUARD: The feast is over.
SANDOR CLEGANE: It doesn't sound like it's over.
FREY GUARD: If I tell you it's over, it's over. Turn this cart around and get the hell out of here."
SANDOR CLEGANE: Got pig's feet, too ."
FREY GUARD: Are you soft in the head? Turn this cart around!
WALDER: I feel I've been remiss in my duties.
WALDER: I've given you meat and wine and music but I haven't shown you the hospitality you deserve. My king has married and I owe my new queen a wedding gift.
CATELYN STARK: Robb!
MAN: You ready to head home to Winterfell, eh?"
MAN: Feast over yet, is it?"
FREY MAN: Aye, it's over!"
SANDOR CLEGANE: It's too late.
WALDER: The King in the North arises, heh heh."
CATELYN STARK: Lord Walder! Lord Walder, enough! Let it end! Please! He is my son! My first son! Let him go and I swear that we will forget this! I swear it by the Old Gods and New! We will take no vengeance."
WALDER: You already swore me one oath right here in my castle. You swore by all the Gods, your son would marry my daughter!"
CATELYN STARK: Take me for a hostage but let Robb go! Robb, get up! Get up and walk out! Please! Please!"
WALDER: And why I would let him do that?
CATELYN STARK: On my honor as a Tully, on my honor as a Stark, let him go or I will cut your wife's throat!"
WALDER: I'll find another.
ROBB STARK: Mother.
ROOSE: The Lannisters send their regards.
